snippet: Abu Ghraib should have taught us that oversight is not the enemy.
abstract: Op-Ed article by retired Army Major Gen Antonio M Taguba criticizes Central Intelligence Agency and others trying to discredit Senate report on CIA's interrogation and torture of terrorism suspects; recalls his investigation of criminal abuses at Abu Ghraib prison in Baghdad, saying his findings, as well as graphic images of abuse, led to prosecutions, urges Pres Obama to insist that CIA accept oversight.
lead_paragraph: Abu Ghraib should have taught us that oversight is not the enemy.

headline.main: Stop the C.I.A. Spin on the Senate Torture Report
headline.print_headline: Stop the C.I.A. Spin on Torture

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
